poem:
Title: "In Coin and Complication"

In love's bloom, the ledger reads aloud,
Bared, where the quick of heartbeats lie.
Unfolding but devotion, veiled by shroud,
An unhinged suite, seared against the sky.

"Every indictment's outstretched hand," he sighs,
A thrumming chorus in her ear.
Witch hunts and love, tangled and unwise,
Steeled her side, through gilded fear.

In this dance, Trump's testament of dime,
A strange Valentine, cast in his prime.
